channel.title: Axoloti for sale?
channel.description:
Hey guys :)
I have a few friends who didnt make the crowdfunding when it was due. And they are really really interested. So if anyone realize they are not into Axoloti anyway or they bought "too many", please let me know. I know a few people who are REALLY interested in getting one :)
I got two and they aint getting mine :)

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @javifr Javi FernÃ¡ndez
item.description:
@javifr wrote:

Hi Peter!

Sorry to disturb, but I'm very interested in a comment you made on the forum, the one you told about building a PD interpreter instrument you did for fun.

I'm interested mainly in building something similar to the Critter and Guitari Organelle ( easily load pure data patches as synths, fx processor, sequencer etc... ) with stereo audio i/o, midi i/o ( usb is fine.. ) , some nice controllers ( knobs, maybe some buttons ) and also hdmi outoput.

Yo talked about using RPI2 / WolfsonCard / Midi USB Adapter / Arduino for Display handling and Knob control.
Do you thing that is a good option? ( Does Rpi3 would do a better job? do you thing that's easy to add an Oled panel? )

I've got a strong sw background but I'm a complete newbie to hw. Could you give me some guidance? Do you thing that for a first hardware project is too ambitious?

Thanks you so much in advance,

Javi

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @hesspet Peter HeÃŸ
item.description:
@hesspet wrote:

I put a new and a used board on ebay:

  • 291668877113
  • 291668869680

Can't work anymore with the board due to a problem with my eyes, soldering is nearly impossible now. I put the boards on the selfs and can't used them. So now is a good time do sell the boards for a fair price within Europe, maybe they find a good new user

Peter

Greetings Peter.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

it would be important to know if the codec was the same, otherwise it would be a reasonable amount of dev work to get it working. (dev work that obviously we cannot expect @johannes to do).

but of course the code is open source so you can have a go. (again have realistic expectations about how much help will be available here)

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @controlvoltage Amos Gaynes
item.description:
@controlvoltage wrote:

If someone wants to build their own, this link might be somewhat helpful:
http://ebrombaugh.studionebula.com/synth/stm32f4_codec_v2/index.html

Not an Axoloti (TM) but a DIY ARM STM32F4 development board with audio codec and I/O. Maybe it would run Axoloti firmware? Not sure

item.title: Axoloti for sale?

item.description:
@dudeldidudel wrote:

dudeldidudel:

291581044518

I posted it on ebay.de - apparently they handle the EU separately from .com and .co.uk? I would ship it to the UK, but I can't help you if ebay decides not to make that offer available from your country. Try searching for "axoloti core", maybe it will show up. That used to work internationally a few years back, no idea what they are up to now.

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @matthewcieplak Matthew Cieplak
item.description:
@matthewcieplak wrote:

I think it would be a good idea to start a mailing list or something similar just so people can just add their name if they're interested and be notified if another batch does get made. This would give Johannes a way to gauge interest in another run and give people who missed the IG campaign the opportunity to get in on the next one without having to check the forums every week.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?

Axoloti for sale? Hardware
Hey guys [smile] I have a few friends who didnt make the crowdfunding when it was due. And they are really really interested. So if anyone realize they are not into Axoloti anyway or they bought "too many", please let me know. I know a few people who are REALLY interested in getting one [smile] I got two and they aint getting mine [smile]

@thetechnobear @johannes maybe these 2 threads should be merged into one to keep information in 1 place?

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Im sure there are a few things that need to be put in place to support general ordering/delivery (its a slightly different process to indiegogo fulfilment) and of course @johannes has been pretty busy up till now with fulfilment. so probably needs a little more time to firm up plans for next batch.

@alex of course, all the the things you mentioned are important, and can be done in parallel and are a continuous process.

hopefully won't be too long, the more axoloti users the merrier

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @natcl
item.description:
@natcl wrote:

?
Not everybody was aware of the Indigogo campaign... Would've bought a couple boards if I had known at the time.
If he does a new batch and makes profit on it I don't see where's the problem... We're not asking for free
samples...
Anyway, will sit patiently until it's available commercially.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @alex alex
item.description:
@alex wrote:

sorry, but you just should have joined the Indiegogo project.

i'm sure a lot of work went into all this, and I think it isnt fair to ask for a new batch right after the first release. I can't speak for the creator(s) but I hope the first priority is to fix some bugs, build a community and get some user-feedback . With that some improvements could be made and an even better product be delivered.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti for sale?
item.dc:creator: @natcl
item.description:
@natcl wrote:

Same here, I hope it'll be released soon !
